meanings.definition: An old woman, especially one who is considered to be unpleasant or bossy.
meanings.sent1: The beldames in the neighborhood always scolded the children for playing too loudly.
meanings.sent2: The village gossips often referred to Mrs. Jenkins as one of the local beldames.
meanings.sent3: The beldames at the knitting club argued over who had the best recipe for apple pie.
meanings.sent4: The beldames' cackling laughter echoed through the empty streets at midnight.
meanings.sent5: The image of the beldames shaking their canes at the passing cars stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: A group of old women who are seen as witches or evil.
meanings.sent1: Legends spoke of a coven of beldames who cast spells on the townsfolk.
meanings.sent2: The children whispered about the beldames who lived deep in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The beldames' black cats prowled the streets on Halloween night.
meanings.sent4: The beldames' eyes glowed with an otherworldly light as they chanted under the full moon.
meanings.sent5: The townspeople avoided the beldames' cottage at all costs, fearing their dark magic.
